title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.1 BASIC EDUCATION

description.narrative: Output 2.1: Education stakeholders at different levels have improved capacity in education planning and programme implementation to improve access to quality education for the most disadvantaged children., which contributes to Children With Disabilities, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2: Increased and equitable access to quality education for the most marginalised children aged 3-18 years.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.1: Education stakeholders at different levels have improved capacity in education planning and programme implementation toimprove access to quality education for the most disadvantaged children.

description.narrative: National and sub-national governments remain strongly committed with enhanced capacity to improve access to quality, inclusive education for out-of-school children (OOSC) and children with disabilities (CWD). Good practices from the OOSC and inclusive education programmes contributed to the development of provincial action plans for the programmes replication in other areas. With UNICEF&39;s direct support, around 26,770 OOSC (44% girls, 95% adolescents) have enrolled back in school through formal or non-formal education. In addition, around 402,000 children with and without disabilities (48.4% girls, 3.5% with disabilities) have learned social inclusion values (e.g. respect, teamwork, tolerance) through physical education and sports. | Status:Met | As-of Date:06/12/2020
